title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: What’s below Antarctica’s ice? New map provides clearest view yet
items.description: Technique could improve models of how ice flows, bolstering predictions of sea level rise

items.title: In fish, low doses of common pesticide speed aging and death
items.description: Polluted lakes and lab experiments highlight harms of chronic exposure to chlorpyrifos

items.title: On a Galápagos island, a ‘restoration project on steroids’
items.description: A multimillion-dollar plan aims to undo centuries of destruction on islands made famous by Darwin

items.title: Scientists turn cells’ most mysterious structures into spies on genetic activity
items.description: Enigmatic ‘vaults’ can be engineered to eavesdrop on RNA, aiding cancer studies and more

items.title: Slow grower: Tyrannosaurus rex didn’t reach full size until age 40
items.description: Famed dino likely spent much of its life competing for food against smaller predators

items.title: Chinese telescope in Antarctica probes uncharted heavenly radiation
items.description: Terahertz instrument at Dome A, world’s driest spot, traces the faint glow of gases beyond other telescopes’ reach

items.title: AI has supercharged scientists—but may have shrunk science
items.description: Analysis of 41 million papers finds that although AI expands individual impact, it narrows collective scientific exploration

items.title: Urban dandelions have evolved to stay close to home. That’s bad news
items.description: Small seed “parachutes” may be causing inbreeding

items.title: The Arctic’s ‘last ice area’ is showing signs of weakness
items.description: Mission to Canada’s Queen Elizabeth Islands reveals degradation of a sea ice haven

items.title: How to cool down African homes—and keep mosquitoes out
items.description: Painting roofs white and adding screens to doors and windows is a low-cost way to increase comfort and curb malaria risk
